trans-unit.source: Add company branding to your Sign In and Access Panel pages
trans-unit.target: Add company branding to your Sign In and Access Panel pages

trans-unit.source: A topic that explains how an organization can apply a consistent look and feel across all the websites and services they manage so that their end users won’t be confused whenever they need to use those sites.
trans-unit.target: A topic that explains how an organization can apply a consistent look and feel across all the websites and services they manage so that their end users won’t be confused whenever they need to use those sites.

trans-unit.source: Add company branding to your Sign In and Access Panel pages
trans-unit.target: Add company branding to your Sign In and Access Panel pages

trans-unit.source: Company branding is a feature that is available only if you upgraded to the Premium or Basic edition of Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: Company branding is a feature that is available only if you upgraded to the Premium or Basic edition of Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Azure Active Directory editions](active-directory-editions.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Azure Active Directory editions](active-directory-editions.md).

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory Premium and Basic editions are available for customers in China using the worldwide instance of Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory Premium and Basic editions are available for customers in China using the worldwide instance of Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory Premium and Basic editions are not currently supported in the Microsoft Azure service operated by 21Vianet in China.
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory Premium and Basic editions are not currently supported in the Microsoft Azure service operated by 21Vianet in China.

trans-unit.source: For more information, contact us at the [Azure Active Directory Forum](http://feedback.azure.com/forums/169401-azure-active-directory).
trans-unit.target: For more information, contact us at the [Azure Active Directory Forum](http://feedback.azure.com/forums/169401-azure-active-directory).

trans-unit.source: Many companies want to apply a consistent look and feel across all the websites and services they manage so that their end users won’t be confused whenever they need to use those sites.
trans-unit.target: Many companies want to apply a consistent look and feel across all the websites and services they manage so that their end users won’t be confused whenever they need to use those sites.

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory provides this capability by allowing you to customize the appearance of the following end user-facing web pages so that they include your company logo and color schemes:
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory provides this capability by allowing you to customize the appearance of the following end user-facing web pages so that they include your company logo and color schemes:

trans-unit.source: **Sign In page** - This page is where users are redirected when they are signing in to Office 365 or other web-based and modern applications that use Azure AD as your identity provider.
trans-unit.target: **Sign In page** - This page is where users are redirected when they are signing in to Office 365 or other web-based and modern applications that use Azure AD as your identity provider.

trans-unit.source: Most users will interact with this page whether it’s to go through Home Realm Discovery, which allows the system to redirect federated users to their on-premises STS (such as AD FS), or to enter their credentials.
trans-unit.target: Most users will interact with this page whether it’s to go through Home Realm Discovery, which allows the system to redirect federated users to their on-premises STS (such as AD FS), or to enter their credentials.

trans-unit.source: **Access Panel page** - The Access Panel is a web-based portal that allows an end user with a work or school account in an Azure AD directory to view and launch cloud-based applications to which they have been granted access by the Azure AD administrator.
trans-unit.target: **Access Panel page** - The Access Panel is a web-based portal that allows an end user with a work or school account in an Azure AD directory to view and launch cloud-based applications to which they have been granted access by the Azure AD administrator.

trans-unit.source: The Access Panel is accessible to all users in your organization at myapps.microsoft.com.
trans-unit.target: The Access Panel is accessible to all users in your organization at myapps.microsoft.com.

trans-unit.source: Sign in page customization
trans-unit.target: Sign in page customization

trans-unit.source: The Sign In page is typically the most frequently used web page by end users that need browser-based access to the cloud apps and services that your organization subscribes to, so making sure it looks right is paramount.
trans-unit.target: The Sign In page is typically the most frequently used web page by end users that need browser-based access to the cloud apps and services that your organization subscribes to, so making sure it looks right is paramount.

trans-unit.source: If you want to use the default non-branded Sign In page experience, you need do nothing.
trans-unit.target: If you want to use the default non-branded Sign In page experience, you need do nothing.

trans-unit.source: How long does it take to see branding changes on the sign in pages?
trans-unit.target: How long does it take to see branding changes on the sign in pages?

trans-unit.source: It can take up to an hour for users to see any new change you made to the sign in page branding.
trans-unit.target: It can take up to an hour for users to see any new change you made to the sign in page branding.

trans-unit.source: When will users see a branded sign in page?
trans-unit.target: When will users see a branded sign in page?

trans-unit.source: User will see a branded sign in page when they visit a service with a tenant-specific URL such as https://outlook.com/**contoso**.com, or https://mail.**contoso**.com (if you’ve created a CNAME).
trans-unit.target: User will see a branded sign in page when they visit a service with a tenant-specific URL such as https://outlook.com/**contoso**.com, or https://mail.**contoso**.com (if you’ve created a CNAME).

trans-unit.source: If they visit a service with non-tenant specific URLs (such as https://mail.office365.com) they will see a non-branded sign in page.
trans-unit.target: If they visit a service with non-tenant specific URLs (such as https://mail.office365.com) they will see a non-branded sign in page.

trans-unit.source: The sign in page will refresh to show your branding once users have entered their user ID or selected a user tile.
trans-unit.target: The sign in page will refresh to show your branding once users have entered their user ID or selected a user tile.

trans-unit.source: Your domain name must appear as “Active” in the **Active Directory** > **Directory** > **Domains** section of the Azure Management Portal where you have configured branding.
trans-unit.target: Your domain name must appear as “Active” in the **Active Directory** > **Directory** > **Domains** section of the Azure Management Portal where you have configured branding.

trans-unit.source: Sign in page branding doesn’t carry over to Microsoft’s consumer sign in page.
trans-unit.target: Sign in page branding doesn’t carry over to Microsoft’s consumer sign in page.

trans-unit.source: This means that users who sign in with a personal Microsoft account (formerly Windows Live ID) may see a branded list of user tiles rendered by Azure AD, but your organization’s branding will not apply to the Microsoft account sign-in page.
trans-unit.target: This means that users who sign in with a personal Microsoft account (formerly Windows Live ID) may see a branded list of user tiles rendered by Azure AD, but your organization’s branding will not apply to the Microsoft account sign-in page.

trans-unit.source: What will my end users see after I customize the Sign In page?
trans-unit.target: What will my end users see after I customize the Sign In page?

trans-unit.source: If you want to show your company brand, colors and other customizable elements on this page, see the following images to understand the difference between the two experiences.
trans-unit.target: If you want to show your company brand, colors and other customizable elements on this page, see the following images to understand the difference between the two experiences.

trans-unit.source: When a user attempts to sign in from a desktop computer, here is an example of what the user would see on the Office 365 Sign In page *before* customization:
trans-unit.target: When a user attempts to sign in from a desktop computer, here is an example of what the user would see on the Office 365 Sign In page *before* customization:

trans-unit.source: And here is what the same user would see *after* customization:
trans-unit.target: And here is what the same user would see *after* customization:

trans-unit.source: When a user attempts to sign in from a mobile device, here is an example of what the user would see on the Office 365 Sign In page *before* customization:
trans-unit.target: When a user attempts to sign in from a mobile device, here is an example of what the user would see on the Office 365 Sign In page *before* customization:

trans-unit.source: And here is what the same user would see *after* customization:
trans-unit.target: And here is what the same user would see *after* customization:

trans-unit.source: What elements on the page can I customize?
trans-unit.target: What elements on the page can I customize?

trans-unit.source: You can customize the following elements on the Sign In page:
trans-unit.target: You can customize the following elements on the Sign In page:

trans-unit.source: Page element
trans-unit.target: Page element

trans-unit.source: Location on the page
trans-unit.target: Location on the page

trans-unit.source: Banner Logo
trans-unit.target: Banner Logo

trans-unit.source: Shown at the top-right of the page.
trans-unit.target: Shown at the top-right of the page.

trans-unit.source: Replaces the logo that would normally be displayed by the destination site that your users are signing in to (For example.
trans-unit.target: Replaces the logo that would normally be displayed by the destination site that your users are signing in to (For example.

trans-unit.source: Office 365 or Azure).
trans-unit.target: Office 365 or Azure).

trans-unit.source: Large Illustration / Background Color
trans-unit.target: Large Illustration / Background Color

trans-unit.source: Shown at the left of the page.
trans-unit.target: Shown at the left of the page.

trans-unit.source: Replaces the image that would normally be displayed by the destination site that your users are signing in to.
trans-unit.target: Replaces the image that would normally be displayed by the destination site that your users are signing in to.

trans-unit.source: The Background Color may be shown in place of the Large Illustration on low bandwidth connections, or on very narrow screens.
trans-unit.target: The Background Color may be shown in place of the Large Illustration on low bandwidth connections, or on very narrow screens.

trans-unit.source: Sign In Page Text
trans-unit.target: Sign In Page Text

trans-unit.source: Shown above the page footer when you need to convey helpful information to your users before they sign in with their work or school account.
trans-unit.target: Shown above the page footer when you need to convey helpful information to your users before they sign in with their work or school account.

trans-unit.source: For example, you may want to include the phone number to your help desk, or a legal statement.
trans-unit.target: For example, you may want to include the phone number to your help desk, or a legal statement.

trans-unit.source: All elements are optional.
trans-unit.target: All elements are optional.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you specify a Banner Logo but no Large Illustration, the Sign In page will show your logo and the illustration for the destination site (that is, the Office 365 California highway image).
trans-unit.target: For example, if you specify a Banner Logo but no Large Illustration, the Sign In page will show your logo and the illustration for the destination site (that is, the Office 365 California highway image).

trans-unit.source: You can also localize all elements on this page.
trans-unit.target: You can also localize all elements on this page.

trans-unit.source: Once you’ve configured a “default” set of customization elements, you can configure additional versions for different locales.
trans-unit.target: Once you’ve configured a “default” set of customization elements, you can configure additional versions for different locales.

trans-unit.source: You can also mix and match various elements.
trans-unit.target: You can also mix and match various elements.

trans-unit.source: For example, you can:
trans-unit.target: For example, you can:

trans-unit.source: Create a “default” Large Illustration that works for all cultures, then create specific versions for English and French.
trans-unit.target: Create a “default” Large Illustration that works for all cultures, then create specific versions for English and French.

trans-unit.source: Users with browsers set to one of these two languages will see the specific image, while everyone else will see the default one.
trans-unit.target: Users with browsers set to one of these two languages will see the specific image, while everyone else will see the default one.

trans-unit.source: Configure different logos for your organization (e.g. Japanese or Hebrew versions).
trans-unit.target: Configure different logos for your organization (e.g. Japanese or Hebrew versions).

trans-unit.source: How will the illustration appear after the browser has been resized?
trans-unit.target: How will the illustration appear after the browser has been resized?

trans-unit.source: During a browser window resizing, the large Illustration, like the one shown previously, will almost always be cropped to accommodate different screen aspect ratios.
trans-unit.target: During a browser window resizing, the large Illustration, like the one shown previously, will almost always be cropped to accommodate different screen aspect ratios.

trans-unit.source: With this in mind, you should try to keep the key visual elements in the illustration so that they will always show in the top-left corner (top-right for right-to-left languages).
trans-unit.target: With this in mind, you should try to keep the key visual elements in the illustration so that they will always show in the top-left corner (top-right for right-to-left languages).

trans-unit.source: This is important because resizing typically occurs from the bottom-right corner going towards the top/left or from the bottom towards the top.
trans-unit.target: This is important because resizing typically occurs from the bottom-right corner going towards the top/left or from the bottom towards the top.

trans-unit.source: The following picture shows how the illustration will be cropped when the browser is resized to the left:
trans-unit.target: The following picture shows how the illustration will be cropped when the browser is resized to the left:

trans-unit.source: And here is how it will appear after the browser is resized toward the top:
trans-unit.target: And here is how it will appear after the browser is resized toward the top:

trans-unit.source: Access panel page customization
trans-unit.target: Access panel page customization

trans-unit.source: The Access Panel page is essentially a portal page for all end users that need quick access, via clickable application tiles, to the various cloud apps that you’ve granted them access to.
trans-unit.target: The Access Panel page is essentially a portal page for all end users that need quick access, via clickable application tiles, to the various cloud apps that you’ve granted them access to.

trans-unit.source: If you want to use the default non-branded Access Panel page experience, you need do nothing.
trans-unit.target: If you want to use the default non-branded Access Panel page experience, you need do nothing.

trans-unit.source: What will my end users see after I have customized the Access Panel page?
trans-unit.target: What will my end users see after I have customized the Access Panel page?

trans-unit.source: Configure your directory with company branding
trans-unit.target: Configure your directory with company branding

trans-unit.source: One default set of customizable elements can be configured per directory in the Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: One default set of customizable elements can be configured per directory in the Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: After defaults have been saved, an administrator also has the option to add localized versions of each element, for different languages/locales.
trans-unit.target: After defaults have been saved, an administrator also has the option to add localized versions of each element, for different languages/locales.

trans-unit.source: All customizable elements are optional.
trans-unit.target: All customizable elements are optional.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you configure a default Banner Logo but no Large Illustration, the Sign In page will display your logo in the upper-right corner, however the site’s default illustration will be displayed.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you configure a default Banner Logo but no Large Illustration, the Sign In page will display your logo in the upper-right corner, however the site’s default illustration will be displayed.

trans-unit.source: If you configure a default Banner Logo and Sign In Page Text in English, and configure language-specific Sign In Page Text for German, then users with a German language preference will see your default Banner Logo but the German text.
trans-unit.target: If you configure a default Banner Logo and Sign In Page Text in English, and configure language-specific Sign In Page Text for German, then users with a German language preference will see your default Banner Logo but the German text.

trans-unit.source: While you could technically configure a different set for each language supported by Azure AD, we recommend that you keep the number of variations low, for maintenance and performance reasons.
trans-unit.target: While you could technically configure a different set for each language supported by Azure AD, we recommend that you keep the number of variations low, for maintenance and performance reasons.

trans-unit.source: To add company branding to your directory:
trans-unit.target: To add company branding to your directory:

trans-unit.source: Sign into the [Azure Management Portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com) as the administrator of the directory you wish to customize.
trans-unit.target: Sign into the [Azure Management Portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com) as the administrator of the directory you wish to customize.

trans-unit.source: Select the directory you wish to customize.
trans-unit.target: Select the directory you wish to customize.

trans-unit.source: Select the **Configure** tab, and then select **Customize Branding**.
trans-unit.target: Select the **Configure** tab, and then select **Customize Branding**.

trans-unit.source: Modify the elements you wish to customize.
trans-unit.target: Modify the elements you wish to customize.

trans-unit.source: Note that all fields are optional.
trans-unit.target: Note that all fields are optional.

trans-unit.source: Click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: It can take up to an hour for users to see any new change you made to the sign in page branding.
trans-unit.target: It can take up to an hour for users to see any new change you made to the sign in page branding.

trans-unit.source: To add language-specific company branding:
trans-unit.target: To add language-specific company branding:

trans-unit.source: In the [Azure Management Portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com), under the **Configure** tab, select **Customize Branding**.
trans-unit.target: In the [Azure Management Portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com), under the **Configure** tab, select **Customize Branding**.

trans-unit.source: Select **Add branding for a specific language**, select the language you want to customize the logo for, and then click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: Select **Add branding for a specific language**, select the language you want to customize the logo for, and then click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: Edit only the elements for which you wish to configure language-specific overrides.
trans-unit.target: Edit only the elements for which you wish to configure language-specific overrides.

trans-unit.source: Note that all fields are optional.
trans-unit.target: Note that all fields are optional.

trans-unit.source: If a field is left blank, then the custom default value will be displayed instead (or the Microsoft default if a custom default is not configured).
trans-unit.target: If a field is left blank, then the custom default value will be displayed instead (or the Microsoft default if a custom default is not configured).

trans-unit.source: Click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: To remove company branding from your directory
trans-unit.target: To remove company branding from your directory

trans-unit.source: In the [Azure Management Portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com), under the **Configure** tab, select **Customize Branding**.
trans-unit.target: In the [Azure Management Portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com), under the **Configure** tab, select **Customize Branding**.

trans-unit.source: On the Customize Branding page, select **Edit Existing Branding Settings** and then go to the next page.
trans-unit.target: On the Customize Branding page, select **Edit Existing Branding Settings** and then go to the next page.

trans-unit.source: Depending on which elements you want to remove, do one or more of the following:
trans-unit.target: Depending on which elements you want to remove, do one or more of the following:

trans-unit.source: For Banner Logo, click on the check box to **Remove uploaded logo**.
trans-unit.target: For Banner Logo, click on the check box to **Remove uploaded logo**.

trans-unit.source: For Tile Logo, click on the check box to **Remove uploaded logo**.
trans-unit.target: For Tile Logo, click on the check box to **Remove uploaded logo**.

trans-unit.source: For Sign In Page User Name Label, clear all text.
trans-unit.target: For Sign In Page User Name Label, clear all text.

trans-unit.source: For Sign In Page Text, clear all text.
trans-unit.target: For Sign In Page Text, clear all text.

trans-unit.source: For Sign In Page Illustration, click on the check box to **Remove illustration**.
trans-unit.target: For Sign In Page Illustration, click on the check box to **Remove illustration**.

trans-unit.source: For Sign In Page Background Color, clear all text.
trans-unit.target: For Sign In Page Background Color, clear all text.

trans-unit.source: Click **Save** to remove the elements.
trans-unit.target: Click **Save** to remove the elements.

trans-unit.source: If necessary, click **Customize Branding** again and repeat these steps for all language-specific branding that needs to be removed.
trans-unit.target: If necessary, click **Customize Branding** again and repeat these steps for all language-specific branding that needs to be removed.

trans-unit.source: All branding settings have been removed when you click **Customize Branding** and see the **Customize Default Branding** form with no existing settings configured.
trans-unit.target: All branding settings have been removed when you click **Customize Branding** and see the **Customize Default Branding** form with no existing settings configured.

trans-unit.source: Testing and examples
trans-unit.target: Testing and examples

trans-unit.source: We recommend that you experiment with a test tenant before making changes in your production environment.
trans-unit.target: We recommend that you experiment with a test tenant before making changes in your production environment.

trans-unit.source: The simplest way to verify if your branding has been applied is to open an InPrivate or Incognito browser session and then visit https://outlook.com/contoso.com, replacing contoso.com with the domain you’ve customized.
trans-unit.target: The simplest way to verify if your branding has been applied is to open an InPrivate or Incognito browser session and then visit https://outlook.com/contoso.com, replacing contoso.com with the domain you’ve customized.

trans-unit.source: Note that this also works with domains that look like contoso.onmicrosoft.com.
trans-unit.target: Note that this also works with domains that look like contoso.onmicrosoft.com.

trans-unit.source: To help you create effective customization sets, we have customized the following two fictitious sign in pages:
trans-unit.target: To help you create effective customization sets, we have customized the following two fictitious sign in pages:

trans-unit.source: http://aka.ms/aaddemo001
trans-unit.target: http://aka.ms/aaddemo001

trans-unit.source: http://aka.ms/aaddemo002
trans-unit.target: http://aka.ms/aaddemo002

trans-unit.source: To test the language-specific settings, you will need to modify the default language preferences in your web browser to a language you have set in your customization.
trans-unit.target: To test the language-specific settings, you will need to modify the default language preferences in your web browser to a language you have set in your customization.

trans-unit.source: In Internet Explorer, this is configured in the **Internet Options** menu.
trans-unit.target: In Internet Explorer, this is configured in the **Internet Options** menu.

trans-unit.source: Customizable elements
trans-unit.target: Customizable elements

trans-unit.source: Some customizable elements in Azure AD have multiple use cases.
trans-unit.target: Some customizable elements in Azure AD have multiple use cases.

trans-unit.source: Company logos can be configured once per directory and is used on both the Sign In and Access Panel pages, where as some customizable elements are specific only to the Sign In page.
trans-unit.target: Company logos can be configured once per directory and is used on both the Sign In and Access Panel pages, where as some customizable elements are specific only to the Sign In page.

trans-unit.source: The following table provides details for the different customizable elements.
trans-unit.target: The following table provides details for the different customizable elements.

trans-unit.source: Name
trans-unit.target: Name

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Constraints
trans-unit.target: Constraints

trans-unit.source: Recommendations
trans-unit.target: Recommendations

trans-unit.source: Banner Logo
trans-unit.target: Banner Logo

trans-unit.source: The Banner Logo is displayed on the Sign In page and the Access panel.
trans-unit.target: The Banner Logo is displayed on the Sign In page and the Access panel.

trans-unit.source: JPG or PNG
trans-unit.target: JPG or PNG

trans-unit.source: 60x280 pixels
trans-unit.target: 60x280 pixels

trans-unit.source: 10 KB
trans-unit.target: 10 KB

trans-unit.source: Use your organization’s full logo (including pictogram and logotype)
trans-unit.target: Use your organization’s full logo (including pictogram and logotype)

trans-unit.source: Keep it under 30 pixels high to avoid introducing scrollbars on mobile devices
trans-unit.target: Keep it under 30 pixels high to avoid introducing scrollbars on mobile devices

trans-unit.source: Keep it under 4 KB
trans-unit.target: Keep it under 4 KB

trans-unit.source: Use a transparent PNG (don’t assume that the Sign In page will always have a white background)
trans-unit.target: Use a transparent PNG (don’t assume that the Sign In page will always have a white background)

trans-unit.source: Tile Logo
trans-unit.target: Tile Logo

trans-unit.source: (currently not used in the Sign In page) In the future, this text may be used to replace the generic “work or school account” pictogram in different places of the experience.
trans-unit.target: (currently not used in the Sign In page) In the future, this text may be used to replace the generic “work or school account” pictogram in different places of the experience.

trans-unit.source: JPG or PNG
trans-unit.target: JPG or PNG

trans-unit.source: 120x120 pixels
trans-unit.target: 120x120 pixels

trans-unit.source: 10 KB
trans-unit.target: 10 KB

trans-unit.source: Keep it simple (no small text), as this image may be resized to 50%
trans-unit.target: Keep it simple (no small text), as this image may be resized to 50%

trans-unit.source: Sign In Page User Name Label
trans-unit.target: Sign In Page User Name Label

trans-unit.source: (currently not used in the Sign In page) In the future, this text may be used to replace the generic “work or school account” string in different places of the experience.
trans-unit.target: (currently not used in the Sign In page) In the future, this text may be used to replace the generic “work or school account” string in different places of the experience.

trans-unit.source: You can set it to something like “Contoso account” or “Contoso ID”.
trans-unit.target: You can set it to something like “Contoso account” or “Contoso ID”.

trans-unit.source: Unicode text, up to 50 characters
trans-unit.target: Unicode text, up to 50 characters

trans-unit.source: Plain text only (no links or HTML tags)
trans-unit.target: Plain text only (no links or HTML tags)

trans-unit.source: Keep it short and simple
trans-unit.target: Keep it short and simple

trans-unit.source: Ask your users how they usually refer to the work or school account you provide them with.
trans-unit.target: Ask your users how they usually refer to the work or school account you provide them with.

trans-unit.source: Sign In Page Text
trans-unit.target: Sign In Page Text

trans-unit.source: This “boilerplate” text appears below the Sign In page form and can be used to communicate additional instructions, or where to get help and support.
trans-unit.target: This “boilerplate” text appears below the Sign In page form and can be used to communicate additional instructions, or where to get help and support.

trans-unit.source: Unicode text, up to 256 characters
trans-unit.target: Unicode text, up to 256 characters

trans-unit.source: Plain text only (no links or HTML tags)
trans-unit.target: Plain text only (no links or HTML tags)

trans-unit.source: Keep it under 250 characters (approximately 3 lines of text)
trans-unit.target: Keep it under 250 characters (approximately 3 lines of text)

trans-unit.source: Sign In Page Illustration
trans-unit.target: Sign In Page Illustration

trans-unit.source: The illustration is a large image that is displayed on the Sign In page to the left of the Sign In page form.
trans-unit.target: The illustration is a large image that is displayed on the Sign In page to the left of the Sign In page form.

trans-unit.source: JPG or PNG
trans-unit.target: JPG or PNG

trans-unit.source: 500 KB
trans-unit.target: 500 KB

trans-unit.source: 1420x1200 pixels
trans-unit.target: 1420x1200 pixels

trans-unit.source: Important: Keep it as small as possible, ideally under 200 KB.
trans-unit.target: Important: Keep it as small as possible, ideally under 200 KB.

trans-unit.source: If this image is too large, it will impact the performance of the Sign In page when the image isn’t cached
trans-unit.target: If this image is too large, it will impact the performance of the Sign In page when the image isn’t cached

trans-unit.source: This image WILL almost always be cropped, to accommodate different screen ratios.
trans-unit.target: This image WILL almost always be cropped, to accommodate different screen ratios.

trans-unit.source: Keep the primary visual elements in the top left corner (top right for RTL languages), because resizing will occur from the bottom/right corner, going towards the top/left, as the browser window shrinks.
trans-unit.target: Keep the primary visual elements in the top left corner (top right for RTL languages), because resizing will occur from the bottom/right corner, going towards the top/left, as the browser window shrinks.

trans-unit.source: Sign In Page Background Color
trans-unit.target: Sign In Page Background Color

trans-unit.source: The Sign In page background color is used in the area to the left of the Sign In page form.
trans-unit.target: The Sign In page background color is used in the area to the left of the Sign In page form.

trans-unit.source: This is visible either when there is no Sign In page illustration present.
trans-unit.target: This is visible either when there is no Sign In page illustration present.

trans-unit.source: Must be a RGB color in hexadecimal form (example: #FFFFFF)
trans-unit.target: Must be a RGB color in hexadecimal form (example: #FFFFFF)

trans-unit.source: The background color may be shown in place of the Large Illustration on low bandwidth connections
trans-unit.target: The background color may be shown in place of the Large Illustration on low bandwidth connections

trans-unit.source: We suggest to pick the primary color of the Banner Logo
trans-unit.target: We suggest to pick the primary color of the Banner Logo
